title: Camera visualization causes GLWidget to freeze on OSX

content.raw:
Inserting a model that has a camera with the `<visualize>` tag set to true causes the rendering of the GLWidget to freeze on OSX. These models include the [camera](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/391a3377cae498583939e788b8971a11d340dd73/camera/model.sdf?at=default) and [pr2](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/391a3377cae498583939e788b8971a11d340dd73/pr2/model.sdf?at=default) in the model database.

After inserting one of these models, the 3D rendering freezes, though the time continues to display at the bottom of the screen, and the topic viewers work as well (even the camera image topic viewers).
content.html:
Inserting a model that has a camera with the <visualize> tag set to true causes the rendering of the GLWidget to freeze on OSX. These models include the camera and pr2 in the model database.

After inserting one of these models, the 3D rendering freezes, though the time continues to display at the bottom of the screen, and the topic viewers work as well (even the camera image topic viewers).
